review_title: not for those with short attention spans
one_reviews_text: i don't get some people on here. they give these short reviews that trash the game with absolutely no explanation except 'it's boring'. yeah sure buddy, how come i enjoyed it so much then. some people just like complain about everything. trust me, they're full of it. i've played it a bunch of times and I'm still not tired of it.  I've seen all the other coaster games that are available and this was one of the best. Kinda makes me wonder if they're being paid by competitors to give bad reviews. And fyi people if it makes you queasy don't play. It's a coaster game for crying out loud.

review_title: Space is no place for a coaster
one_reviews_text: Compared to other coaster games I have played this is pretty meh. Space also is no ideal place for a rollar coaster because you have no sense of your position above the ground.

I guess the coasters speed is internally recalculated every 2 seconds. At least what I see is that the coaster slows down over 2 seconds and then gets a noticable boost - this loops repeats during the whole ride. It feel slike being kicked around, and it totally breaks immersion. :-/

A fairly standard rollercoaster experience. Nothing spectacular here but the graphics are nice, it's a shame everything either takes place in a macro-scale (space) or a micro-scale (outdoors/room). You don't really get a sense of vertigo, well at least I didn't. 

The room rollercoaster was by far the best but also the shortest. 

The experiences, combined, make for around 12.5 minutes of entertainment, they aren't really amazing enough to revisit, except perhaps after a significant amount of time has passed, so replayability is pretty low for me. 

Grab this one on sale. 3/5
Pretty lame
I got it for my brother, who is 5. He loves it, but quality wise it feels floaty and underwhelming. It's not terrible, though. Don't expect too much
i got this for my girlfriend, she played it for 5 min then broke up with me by text, can i get a refund?
not bad but not worth any amount of money
Worth a couple bucks easy.

If you want to *calmly* soar through cool environments while listening to nice music (the music fits my tastes, but maybe not for others), then this is your game. As other reviewers have stated, there is no roller coaster physics in this game, but that is what I like about it. It's more like a powered glider ride on autopilot. I have another roller coaster game that I use for thrilling rides, but when I want to relax, I fire this game up.  Movements are very calm and relaxing, and the environments are well designed and interesting.  You will be disappointed if you think of this as a standard roller coaster sim. The only thing I would change about this game is maybe the title, as people expect a roller coaster type ride.

You "fly" through 4 scenes with a complete static background, lots of static objects and some moving objects - and some boring relaxation music. Each course is like 3-4 minutes long.
I just went through them all and it was boring. I could stand without problems and am not even slightly uncomfortable - there is no roller coaster feeling.
A major problem is, that the speed is quite constant - you don't feel the speed in the large scale scenes. The last room scene was the best one in this regard and also with the follwing issue:
The vehicle tilt is often the same, even through tight curves - it just doesn't feel like a roller coaster.

Sometimes I just wished for a weapon and that I could shoot out of this vehicle - but no hand tracking either. ;)
I wanted to experience a fun rollercoaster, and this game did just that! Unfortunately I got motion sickness quite quickly, but it was enjoyable for the duration that I was playing it!

review_title: Nice roller. Best is moon roller.
one_reviews_text: But is  bug. If you want start  the other roller you can t .You need exit software  then enter again and then choose the other roller.
review_feedback:
Hi Ernestastastas, 
Thanks for pointing out the bug!  We have updated Coaster and you can now select any coaster from any scene :)

one_reviews_text: It looks ok, but the physics are pretty bad and that breaks all immersion. You get no sence of riding on a track. You're just floating around  and the track isn't really fixed. Feels like the car "sucks in"  the rubberbandlike track. Terrible sound as well. A quick uninstall.
Get your barf bags ready!
Nice long(ger than most) runs.   Need Quite a few turns through each run to see all that is there!

Lacks the exciting anticipation of going up a rollercoaster before the drop. Almost all tracks just start very fast without any of the real rollercoaster physics or fun. Music is distracting but thankfully you can turn it off. Coaster sound effects are poor and bubbly/distorted, they don't sound like a real rollercoaster at all. Environments are creative but the models are low quality and their placement could be more dynamic and interesting.
Would be nice if it would install... at all
review_feedback:
Hi Captain_Howdy, 
Please visit https://support.oculus.com/ to resolve your issue and then come back and let us know what you think of the experience.
Thanks!

one_reviews_text: It's one of the better coaster experiences. Very fun to show off VR potential. Creative in many ways, though can suffer from "I'm kinda getting bored" syndrome underwriting every VR coaster game. Still, a great trip for the money.
Almost made me puke in my chair.
I'm a rift user, and this game just does nor respond no matter what you do. Waste of money.

It's not a lot of content, but the rides are superb (space one in particular), and its really really cheap. This is one of the those apps you'll use to awe your friends with on their first VR expierence.

review_title: The best coaster on the rift!
one_reviews_text: -i tried by now.. There arent many maps/tracks but the ones which are there, are awesome! And especially for the price, it`s totally worth it!

It's okay for the low price. The scenery is nice and the sensation of motion is fairly convincing, but in places the speed of the rails moving towards you doesn't match the speed of the world moving past  and this detracts from the immersion somewhat.  Still, it's okay as a quick introduction to motion in VR.

Cheaper than a pint and much more satisfying. Each track had its own highlights for me; Room=sense of Speed, Picnic=sense of Height, Space=Tranquility, Moon=a really nice pic of earth. Ok, Moon was a bit weak compared to the others! :) But even if it was the only track available, it would still give better value for money than many other things that cost £2

This is a good roller coaster. My first VR coaster experience. The rides are of about 4minutes duration and give a good approximatiopn of roller coaster rides. The only problem I had - not sure if app or occulus - was that the rift stuck on 'hourglass' after each ride. Did not return to menu. A minor problem as I only planned on one ride per day.

You get what you pay for with this but these coasters are fun to watch. The immersion is certainly missing, but I didn't pay for that. I paid for some roller coaster videos and thats what I got. If you haven't tried VR Roller Coasters before, give this one a go

I've tried lots of VR coasters before, but this four pack is the best. My favorites were the picnic and house, as they were beautiful and outside on a warm summer's day. Mild thrills, but I'd love to see more from this dev.

I REALLY like this compilation of coasters! They are creative, moody, the rides aren't to short, and they really offer variety! Good rides for in-between - good quality and not overpriced at all! Great!

review_title: My First VR Coaster and it was Good
one_reviews_text: I am throughly enjoying this VR coaster app.  I LOVE riding coasters and was curious to see if VR would fill the void since I can't get away to Disney/Hershey like I used to. These rides are good and I'm impressed with them simulating the actual experience.  I'm taking it easy since still getting my VR legs and so far so good, no motion sickness; but I do just ride one at a time then go back a day later and ride another.  So far the picnic coaster is my favorite in this app.  I've only riden one other VR coaster app (the darkness coaster, or something to that affect) and both have been good, just different effects.  I'll be trying others since there are so many to choose from.

Dont get how people in other reviews think this is such a great coaster game(5 stars means its almost perfect). The best Coaster game for VR at the moment is NoLimits 2.
Graphics - Sharp but simple assets
Rides - Mediocer 
Sound - Music is fine(and you can turn it off) but the soundeffects of the ride self could use more detail.
Can't get out of the coaster select screen, the game just ignores all inputs.

I really thought I was simulator sickness proof in the meantime. But this here really has an impact. Not sure why.

Except that it look great. Not so much the rails in fron of you and also they are just floating, but the scenes are really fun. The 4 sound tracks are nice and so are the coasters. Most I like the start jump of the moon level and the cat in the room level =)

Graphics are really very good for VR and nicely balanced for fidelity and high frame rate, I never had the feeling the framerate drops. So real good work!

review_title: Finally, coasters done right in VR
one_reviews_text: There are a plethora of "roller coaster" apps out there that vary wildly in quality. Most of them are complete disappointments. Scaling can be wrong, speed is unrealistic, graphics are ugly and immersion breaking, etc. However, I can finally say that they have finally done it right this time. This feels like an "Oculus 2.0" app in terms of quality. It has several things going for it. For $3, you get 4 high-quality rides. The environments are gorgeous and absolutely MASSIVE. They nailed it. Stunning to look at. There are not any settings options, but I am almost 100% certain that 2.0 Supersampling is on by default (GTX 1070). Graphics are sharp and crystal clear. There are no harsh turns (attributed to many cheap VR coaster apps) and every ride is immersive. There are unexpected surprises on every track. There is a soundtrack to each coaster, although it is not synced to the movement of the track. However, it fits the theme of each ride. The tracks are quite long. This is the quality we have been longing for in a VR coaster. I was extremeley delighted multiple times and because the environments are so large, the sense of speed does not cause motion sickness (cover up the track in front of you, or look to the side, and it simply feels like you are casually flying through the environments). Not sure how large the dev team is for Coasters, but well done!

review_title: 4 roller coaster rides, each of them fun
one_reviews_text: So there are a lot of VR rollercoaster games out there.  This is one of the best of them, if not the best.  There are 4 rides in one game.  Each of them is fun and unique.  There is such great attention to detail  From the butterfiles, to the honey bees, to the tricycle, to the space station, to the space warp effects.  You can tell that this developer put lots of hours of love into this passion project.  This is what separates this game from most other VR roller coasters ... commitment to creating a wonderful VR world environment so you can enjoy your VR rollercoaster ride and escape reality and enter a magical virtual world full of thrills and wonder.

Once I was able to discover how to launch each coaster ride with the touchpad select button, I agree with most reviewers. This was a very satistying variety of coasters. Not too short, not too long, and a good variety, especially for the inexpensive price.
Very intense and nice experience

I've got most of the coaster apps, and this is the best one by far.  It's incredibly smooth, and polished and is the only coaster app that actually takes my stomach away - just like the real thing!  I hope they make more!
Rather enjoyed the ride, found that lifting my feet off the floor added to the sensation of speed and movement, only 4 stars as it makes me queasy a little bit when i play :)
Definitely worth buying considering low price

review_title: Great way to show off VR
one_reviews_text: Absolutely amazing effects and graphics.  Excellent way to show a friend what they can experience with VR.  Hope they add a few new coasters over time.  i would pay per coaster.  Maybe one through some dinosaurs or the north pole?  Fireworks?  In any event, what is here is excellent. - I am using a GTX 970 and it was perfectly smooth.

Marvellous and stunning.. Well it was for me. The Moon ride is amazing but so are the others. All with suprises and nice music. The perspective of the tracks are a little unusual but well done. Great for the price!

for 3:99 you cant go wrong. stunning detail and graphics !! im using a GTX 1070 it it hardly uses much of it's capacity ! wont be long though my 1070 will be old news and ill need to update, but for now I dont have any problems with anything. get this game. you wont be sorry !
LOVE THIS.....especially the PIcnic one......sound design is amazing.......had a friend ride this coaster, she Loved it - but it made her feel queezy - but Real ones do too....
I get the feel of a real rollercoaster when i ride! I like to sit when i ride because otherwise i'll fall over. I really like this game. (BTW I like picnic coaster best)
I`ve played a bunch of coasters since getting this Rift a few weeks ago but this one is the most interesting. The feel of the drops and bends are far superior to other experiences.
For what i paid, i'm happy. Well made, very smooth graphically, never jitters constant FPS. I'm giving this 5stars cos they spent some time making it nice.
The rides were fun and looked good, it was a great experience and for 3 quid, can't really go wrong, fun thing to show family and friends!
For the cost of this it's a fun experience, not for those that get dizzy easily!
love it
I`ve played a bunch of coasters since getting this Rift a few weeks ago but this one is the most interesting. The feel of the drops and bends are far superior to other experiences.
For what i paid, i'm happy. Well made, very smooth graphically, never jitters constant FPS. I'm giving this 5stars cos they spent some time making it nice.
The rides were fun and looked good, it was a great experience and for 3 quid, can't really go wrong, fun thing to show family and friends!
For the cost of this it's a fun experience, not for those that get dizzy easily!
love it
